summary: This is an email chain between FBI personnel and Assistant U.S. Attorneys from the Southern District of New York regarding the shipping of approximately 23 boxes of case records from two FBI case files (72-MM-113327 and 31E-MM-108062) for an investigation. The emails coordinate logistics and confirm contact information for the prosecutors.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: The sender of the initial email, identifying themselves and a colleague as the prosecutors working on the investigation, providing contact information and details about the case records being shipped.

events.title: Prosecutor Contact and Case Details Provided
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney emails FBI contacts to provide full contact information for themselves and a colleague, confirming they are the prosecutors on the investigation and detailing the approximate volume and source of case records to be shipped.
personsInvolved: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York

events.title: Arrangement for Shipping Case Records
events.description: FBI personnel correspond to arrange the shipment of approximately 23 boxes of case records via FedEx.

events.title: Follow-up on Shipment of Case Records
events.description: An FBI follow-up email notes the boxes were shipped but FedEx tracking shows nothing inbound for that day.

keyFacts: The document is an email chain from July 2019 regarding the physical transfer of case records for an investigation.
Approximately 23 boxes of papers were to be shipped, containing records from two specific FBI case files: 72-MM-113327 (approx. 2 boxes) and 31E-MM-108062 (the remainder).
The correspondence is between FBI personnel and Assistant U.S. Attorneys from the Southern District of New York, who identify themselves as the prosecutors working on the investigation.
The emails are logistical, focusing on shipping coordination and confirming contact information for the legal team.
All specific names of FBI personnel and the second prosecutor are redacted in the provided text, indicated by placeholders like (USANYS) and (FBI).
